page.title: 10TOURISM
page.content:
On May 3,1891 the Honourable Company of Edinburgh Golfers opened their new course at Muirfield .In 1892 the first Open to be held at Muirfield was won by H.H.Hilton. The course record of 63 is held by Asao Aoki. Women and children can only play golf if accompanied by a member,women are not normally allowed into the club.As the club is anxious to preserve the course it therefore only encourages competitions such as the Open and the Ryder Cup.
Greywalls Hotel was built in 1901,the architect was Sir Edward Lutyens.The hotel has maintained its original family house atmosphere.Sports facilities available include tennis and croquet. Food requirements are obtained country wide and wine is bought {(cont. P11)
